title: Contiguous Memory Allocation

description.core_idea: An array stores elements in consecutive memory locations without gaps.
explanation: When an array is created, a continuous block of memory is allocated.
Each element occupies the same fixed number of bytes.
Elements are placed one after another in memory.
The first element has a base address, and all others are located at fixed offsets from it.
key_points: Memory is allocated as one continuous block
There are no gaps between elements
The array has a single base address

examples: An array of 5 integers occupies 5 Ã— 4 = 20 consecutive bytes.
If the base address is 1000, the next element starts at 1004.
common_misconceptions: Array elements are scattered in memory
Each element has its own independent memory block
